title.rendered: 2024 USA Visa Sponsorship Jobs (Salary up to $200,000)

content.rendered:
Planning To work in the USA in 2024? We can help. We have a list of big companies in the USA that want to offer jobs and support with visas.

These companies are looking for skilled people like you. With these jobs, you can earn between $80,000 and $200,000 each year.

Our article will show you these great job chances. We’ll tell you about the big companies and how much they pay. This can make your dream of living and working in the USA come true.

So, if you are thinking of moving to the USA for work, this information is just for you. This is a great chance for you to start a new career in America. Don’t miss out!

Understanding the Visa Sponsorship Package

Before we tell you about the companies that offer jobs with visa support, let’s talk about what you get when you get a visa sponsorship package.

If a company in the USA offers you a job and supports your visa, here are some of the things they might provide:

  1. Help Adjusting to the USA: Moving to a new country can be hard. But don’t worry! These companies will give you tips and help. They’ll guide you on how to live and work in the USA. This means understanding local customs, finding your way around, and settling into your new job.
  2. Flight Tickets: Moving to another country is exciting but can be expensive. Many companies will help you with this cost. They may pay for your first flight ticket to the USA or give you some money to help cover the travel expenses.
  3. A Place to Stay: When you first arrive in the USA, you might not have a permanent place to live yet. These companies understand that. They will give you a temporary place to stay. This can be an apartment or a hotel. This way, you have a comfortable space while you search for your own home.
  4. Help with the Visa Process: Applying for a US visa can be confusing. But with the help of these companies, it becomes easier. They have experts who know all about the visa process. They will guide you, help fill out forms, and answer any questions. This makes sure that you have the best chance to get your visa approved.

In summary, a visa sponsorship package is a big help when moving to the USA for work. It provides support in many areas, from getting there to settling in. If a company offers this package, it shows they really value you and want to make your move as smooth as possible

Top US Companies Willing to Sponsor Visa 2023

If you’re hoping to work in the USA and need visa support, some top companies might be your ticket in. Let’s delve deeper into each one:

1. Apple

Overview: Apple, a technology powerhouse globally, offers various career avenues, particularly for those inclined towards IT and software solutions.

Job Opportunities: Apple frequently looks for software engineers, data analysts, and more.

Salary Expectation: Depending on the role and experience, technical jobs at Apple often have a salary range from $80,000 to $120,000 for starters.

2. Berkshire Hathaway

Overview: An influential conglomerate, Warren Buffet leads it. They offer job opportunities and internships, which makes it ideal for students.

Job Opportunities: They offer positions in finance, investments, and various subsidiaries.

Salary Expectation: Interns can expect to earn between $20-$40 per hour. Full-time roles range from $70,000 to $150,000 annually.

3. Alphabet (Google)

Overview: Google, under its parent Alphabet, has revolutionized tech, affecting millions.

Job Opportunities: Roles in software development, artificial intelligence, and cloud computing are abundant.

Salary Expectation: A software engineer starting their career here can expect between $120,000 to $160,000 yearly.

4. Walmart

Overview: This global retail leader has stores across the U.S. and continually hires for various roles.

Job Opportunities: Beyond in-store positions, Walmart also recruits for its tech and online operations.

Salary Expectation: While store associates earn hourly, managerial roles can fetch anywhere between $50,000 to $150,000 annually.

5. Bank of America

Overview: As one of the top bank chains in the U.S., BofA offers a spectrum of roles in banking and finance.

Job Opportunities: Positions in investment banking, wealth management, and finance are regularly available.

Salary Expectation: An entry-level analyst might earn between $70,000 and $90,000, but seasoned professionals can expect much higher.

6. Johnson & Johnson

Overview: Johnson & Johnson, a global frontrunner in healthcare, is deeply committed to the values of diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Job Opportunities: Positions are available in research, product development, marketing, and sales.

Salary Expectation: Depending on the role and location, employees, especially scientists and engineers, can expect anywhere between $80,000 and $150,000 or more annually.

7. ExxonMobil

Overview: ExxonMobil, a dominant force in the energy sector, offers a vast array of career opportunities.

Job Opportunities: Ranging from engineering to finance and even field roles.

Salary Expectation: Engineers could potentially earn between $70,000 and $150,000 per annum based on their expertise.

8. PepsiCo

Overview: With a global presence, PepsiCo invites candidates to join their expansive talent community.

Job Opportunities: Opportunities span from marketing, sales, to product development.

Salary Expectation: Salaries fluctuate with the role. Entry-level roles might start at $50,000, with leadership roles often reaching six figures.

9. Coca-Cola

Overview: At Coca-Cola, employees become part of a vast professional network.

Job Opportunities: Roles in marketing, production, sales, and more.

Salary Expectation: Salaries can range from $40,000 to $70,000 for starting positions, with leadership roles exceeding $100,000.

10. Amazon

Overview: Amazon, an e-commerce behemoth, continuously hires to fuel its expansive operations.

Job Opportunities: Diverse, ranging from warehousing to IT and corporate roles.

Salary Expectation: Warehouse roles are typically hourly, while specialized roles like software engineering can range from $100,000 to over $200,000.

11. Google (again)

Overview: Apart from regular roles, Google has a massive intake for fresh graduates and students.

Job Opportunities: Numerous, especially in the tech sector.

Salary Expectation: Salaries for software engineers at an entry-level can be between $120,000 and $160,000.

12. Microsoft

Overview: Microsoft, a name synonymous with tech, invites a plethora of candidates every year.

Job Opportunities: Tech roles, marketing, HR, and more.

Salary Expectation: Starting roles can range from $80,000 to $120,000, with top-tier roles often exceeding $150,000.

13. Meta (formerly Facebook)

Overview: Meta oversees platforms like Facebook and WhatsApp and offers varied roles.

Job Opportunities: From tech roles to content creation and marketing.

Salary Expectation: Software engineers at Meta can earn between $120,000 to over $200,000.

14. Intel

Overview: Intel, a tech stalwart, is at the forefront of chip-making and computing.

Job Opportunities: Mainly in engineering, finance, and IT.

Salary Expectation: Entry-level engineers might earn between $70,000 and $100,000.

15. Deloitte

Overview: As a global consultancy leader, Deloitte offers roles in multiple professional services.

Job Opportunities: Auditing, consulting, tax, and advisory are primary areas.

Salary Expectation: Salaries are variable, depending largely on the role and seniority.

All these corporations not only provide a competitive salary but also give international candidates a chance to experience the diverse American work culture, complete with training, networking opportunities, and growth potential.

If you’re considering relocating to the U.S. for work, exploring openings at these companies could be your first step towards a promising career.

In 2023, there are even more companies in the USA that want to help people from other countries work there. They do this by giving something called “visa sponsorship.” This means these companies will help you with the paperwork needed to live and work in the USA. Some of these companies are:

  • Cisco: They are known for their computer networking products.
  • Accenture: This is a big company that gives business advice to other companies.
  • Oracle: They work in computer technology and offer many kinds of products and services.
  • Capgemini: Another business advice company, helping others do their best.
  • Uber: Everyone knows Uber! They help people get rides in cities.
  • Salesforce: This company uses technology to help other businesses talk to their customers.
  • JPMorgan Chase: A very big bank with many services.
  • WarnerMedia: They make movies, TV shows, and other entertainment.

These are just a few examples. There are many more companies in the USA that want to hire people from other places. If you dream of working in America, this is a great time. Check out the websites of these companies to see what jobs they have. Who knows? You might find the perfect job for you in the USA
